JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Giovanni Bonello;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , PERSON and ORG are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and are currently serving prison sentences in GPE . The first and second applicants are married and the third applicant is the sister of the second applicant . The couple 's children have lived in GPE since the applicants were arrested in GPE . The applicants are represented before ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
ORG were represented by their then Agent , PERSON . ORG were represented by their Agent , PERSON , President of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On an unspecified date in DATE the applicants were arrested in GPE .
On DATE the applicants were charged by the NORP authorities with illegally entering NORP territory , setting up and participating in a criminal organisation and drug trafficking .

On DATE ORG , sitting as a first - instance court with a bench of CARDINAL judges , found the applicants guilty and sentenced them to life imprisonment and to the payment of a fine that amounted to MONEY .

On an unspecified date in DATE , since their minor children and family were living in GPE , the applicants lodged a request with ORG pursuant to a DATE LAW between GPE and GPE on the transfer of sentenced persons ( “ the Bilateral Agreement ” ) , seeking to serve their prison sentence in an NORP prison . According to the applicants , in order to fulfil the requirements for their transfer to GPE they waived their right to appeal against the judgment that had led to their conviction .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG requested the NORP authorities to initiate proceedings for the transfer of the applicants to GPE . The standard text of the requests , in so far as relevant , read as follows :

“ I. We hereby inform you that [ the name of the applicant ] , an NORP national serving a sentence in [ the name of prison ] , has requested to be transferred to GPE to serve the remainder of the sentence .
II . ORG has no objection to the transfer of the sentenced person .
III . The following documents have been annexed for your information :
The application form of the sentenced person requesting the transfer .
Copies of the TIME and judgment of ORG of DATE .
Copies of the applicant 's waiver of the right to appeal against the above - mentioned judgment .

On an unspecified date , ORG requested ORG , LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) , to provide them with information about the legal consequences of the transfer of sentenced persons under that country 's criminal law .
Pursuant to the procedure provided for by LAW and LAW , it would appear that on DATE the NORP ORG initiated proceedings in LOC for the validation and enforcement in GPE of the judgment given by ORG .

On DATE the ORG , relying on ORG and LAW , considered that the sentences imposed by the NORP court were compatible with NORP criminal law and found that the applicants should serve the following sentences in GPE : DATE imprisonment for the first applicant and DATE imprisonment for the second and third applicants , in accordance with Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW . Lastly , the court ordered that the applicants should pay the costs of the proceedings . The judgment became final on DATE .

It appears that on DATE ORG informed its NORP counterparts that there existed the possibility of conditional release for the applicants after serving CARDINAL of their sentence , provided that they had displayed good behaviour in prison . Consequently , on DATE ORG informed the applicants and ORG of its refusal to transfer the applicants on the ground that the sentences commuted by the NORP court were inferior to those imposed by the NORP court and thus incompatible with the gravity of their offence and with the short time they had spent in NORP prisons .
In DATE and DATE the applicants unsuccessfully requested that the NORP authorities transfer them to GPE in accordance with the transfer procedure .

It would appear that on DATE the second and third applicants sought leave to appeal out of time against the sentence of DATE . On DATE ORG ( Areios Pagos ) dismissed the appeals against the judgment that had led to their conviction as being time - barred .
On unspecified dates the applicants requested that ORG enforce the judgment of ORG that had converted their NORP sentence and proceed with their transfer to GPE .
On DATE the NORP Ministry of Justice informed the applicants ' family , without giving reasons , that the procedure for their transfer to GPE had been stayed .
On DATE the prosecutor at the ORG informed the applicants ' family of the refusal of ORG to transfer the applicants to GPE .
It appears that in DATE the applicants unsuccessfully requested that the NORP authorities transfer them to GPE in accordance with the transfer procedure .
LAW provides that GPE applies international law that is binding upon it .

Article CARDINAL , as in force at the material time , stated that a prisoner could be conditionally released after serving CARDINAL of the sentence , provided that his good behaviour and work had achieved the goal of educating him .
Article CARDINAL , as in force at the material time , provided that the organisation and initiation of narcotics trafficking was punishable by a maximum sentence of DATE imprisonment .
Article CARDINAL , as in force at the material time , provided that unlawful crossing of the border was punishable by a maximum sentence of DATE imprisonment .
Article CARDINAL of LAW provides for the conditional release of a life prisoner , after having served DATE imprisonment .

The DATE LAW was adopted at a time when GPE was not a ORG to ORG and in many parts reflects the content of that instrument . It entered into force in respect of GPE on DATE . The preamble to the Agreement reads “ GPE and GPE , desirous of further developing cooperation in the field of criminal law , have agreed to conclude an Agreement for ORG ( ... ) . ”

Article CARDINAL states that “ both countries undertake to mutually assist with the transfer of sentenced persons in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement . ” Quite unlike LAW , LAW provides that the sentenced person may also request his transfer , in addition to the sentencing ORG or the administering ORG .

Under Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , a sentenced person may be transferred if the following conditions are met : ( a ) the criminal offence is punishable by the criminal law of the sentencing and the administering ORG ; ( b ) the sentencing judgment is final ; ( c ) the sentenced person is of sound mind ; ( d ) the sentenced person still has DATE of the sentence to serve ; and ( e ) the sentenced person has given his consent to the transfer .

Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide for the grounds on which the transfer may be refused , for example if the sentenced person has not satisfied his obligations in terms of cash , fees , expenses or other penalties to which he is liable , and , if the maximum punishment imposed by the administering ORG is much lower than the one imposed by the sentencing ORG .
ORG entered into force in respect of GPE on DATE and in respect of GPE on DATE . LAW has not been signed or ratified to date by GPE and has been in force in respect of GPE from DATE .
The Preamble to LAW , in so far as relevant , reads :
“ ... Desirous of further developing international co - operation in the field of criminal law ;
Considering that such co - operation should further the ends of justice and the social rehabilitation of sentenced persons ;

Considering that these objectives require that foreigners who are deprived of their liberty as a result of their commission of a criminal offence should be given the opportunity to serve their sentences within their own society ; ... ”
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ A sentenced person may be transferred under this Convention only on the following conditions :
a. if that person is a national of the administering ORG ;
b. if the judgment is final ;
c. if , at the time of receipt of the request for transfer , the sentenced person still has DATE of the sentence to serve or if the sentence is indeterminate ;

d. if the transfer is consented to by the sentenced person or , where in view of his age or his physical or mental condition one of GPE considers it necessary , by the sentenced person 's legal representative ;

e. if the acts or omissions on account of which the sentence has been imposed constitute a criminal offence according to the law of the administering ORG or would constitute a criminal offence if committed on its territory ; and
PERSON if the sentencing and administering GPE agree to the transfer . ”

CARDINAL . If a transfer is requested , the sentencing ORG shall provide the following documents to the administering ORG , unless either ORG has already indicated that it will not agree to the transfer :
a. a certified copy of the judgment and the law on which it is based ;

b. a statement indicating how much of the sentence has already been served , including information on any pre - trial detention , remission , and any other factor relevant to the enforcement of the sentence ;
c. a declaration containing the consent to the transfer as referred to in LAW ; and

d. whenever appropriate , any medical or social reports on the sentenced person , information about his treatment in the sentencing ORG , and any recommendation for his further treatment in the administering ORG . ”
“ CARDINAL . The competent authorities of the administering State shall :
a. NORP continue the enforcement of the sentence immediately or through a court or administrative order , under the conditions set out in DATE , or

b. convert the sentence , through a judicial or administrative procedure , into a decision of that ORG , thereby substituting for the sanction imposed in the sentencing ORG a sanction prescribed by the law of the administering ORG for the same offence , under the conditions set out in LAW .
CARDINAL . The administering ORG , if requested , shall inform the sentencing ORG before the transfer of the sentenced person as to which of these procedures it will follow .
CARDINAL . The enforcement of the sentence shall be governed by the law of the administering ORG and that ORG alone shall be competent to take all appropriate decisions . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . In the case of conversion of sentence , the procedures provided for by the law of the administering ORG apply . When converting the sentence , the competent authority :
a. shall be bound by the findings as to the facts insofar as they appear explicitly or implicitly from the judgment imposed in the sentencing ORG ;
b. may not convert a sanction involving deprivation of liberty to a pecuniary sanction ;
c. shall deduct the full period of deprivation of liberty served by the sentenced person ; and
d. shall not aggravate the penal position of the sentenced person , and shall not be bound by any minimum which the law of the administering ORG may provide for the offence or offences committed .

CARDINAL . NORP If the conversion procedure takes place after the transfer of the sentenced person , the administering State shall keep that person in custody or otherwise ensure his presence in the administering State pending the outcome of that procedure . ”

CARDINAL . If CARDINAL or more Parties have already concluded an agreement or treaty on the transfer of sentenced persons or otherwise have established their relations in this matter , or should they in future do so , they shall be entitled to apply that agreement or treaty or to regulate those relations accordingly , in lieu of the present Convention . ”

“ ORG shall be kept informed regarding the application of this Convention and shall do whatever is necessary to facilitate a friendly settlement of any difficulty which may arise out of its application . ”

Paragraph CARDINAL of its explanatory report states that “ the Convention confines itself to providing the procedural framework for transfers . It does not contain an obligation on Contracting States to comply with a request for transfer ; for that reason , it was not necessary to list any grounds for refusal , or to require the requested ORG to give reasons for its refusal to agree to a requested transfer ” .
